Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Cocktail \Cock"tail`\, n. 1. A beverage made of brandy, whisky, or gin, iced, flavored, and sweetened. [U. S.] [1913 Webster]
2. (Stock Breeding) A horse, not of pure breed, but having only one eighth or one sixteenth impure blood in his veins. --Darwin. [1913 Webster]
3. A mean, half-hearted fellow; a coward. [Slang, Eng.] [1913 Webster]
It was in the second affair that poor little Barney showed he was a cocktail. --Thackeray. [1913 Webster]
4. (Zo["o]l.) A species of rove beetle; -- so called from its habit of elevating the tail. [1913 Webster]
cocktail n 1: a short mixed drink 2: an appetizer served as a first course at a meal
